intro: Leucas tsavoensis, commonly known as the Tsavo leucas, is a flowering plant native to East Africa, particularly found in Kenya and Tanzania. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom during the rainy season. The leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed.
